page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: THIS AREA IS ONE SIDE OF A WIDE RIVER VALLEY.PENDLE WATER FLOWS ALONG THE VALLEY BOTTOM.OVER THE LAST 150 YEARS THE TWO SIDES HAVE DEVELOPED DRAMATICALLY DIFFERENTLY.THE OTHER SIDE HAS A CANAL,RAILWAY,TURNPIKE ROAD,COTTON TOWNS WITH MILLS AND TERRACED HOUSING:19 C.INDUSTRIAL TOWN. OVER SIDE REMAINED MORE RURAL.UP TO 30 YEARS AGO IT WAS NEARLY ALL ROUGH GRAZING LAND WITH 2 SMALL VILLAGES - {HIGHAM AND FENCE.}EACH VILLAGE HAD A SMALL TEXTILE MILL,A FEW SHOPS AND FARM WORKERS.RECENTLY, THESE VILLAGES HAVE GROWN AS COMMUTER VILLAGES BECAUSE ROADS HAVE IMPROVED.OUR NEW MOTORWAY WILL MEAN THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE.THE VILLAGES ARE QUIET,MIDDLE CLASS PLACES,FEW SHOPS,FEW BUS SERVICES,NO VANDALS. CARS ARE ESSENTIAL. PLEASANT SCENIC PLACES WHERE NOT A LOT GOES ON.
